newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal parliament to ponder budget savings plan.
newsitem.headline: Portugal parliament to ponder budget savings plan.

text.p: The government's supplementary budget, sent to parliament on Monday, sees additional state savings equivalent to 0.2 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) this year, the finance ministry said in a statement.
On the spending side, there is an increase on health spending but this is compensated for by lower interest rates and a reduction in contributions to the European Union, it said.
The government has said it sees a 1996 budget deficit of 4.0 percent of GDP, down from the 4.2 percent initially forecast. The deficit was 4.9 percent in 1995.
